boat.name: Bee
boat.full_description:
Built by Frost and Drake of Tollesbury in 1886 and owned by the same family until bought by Dr. Gibson some time in the 1950s or 60s. She was known locally as the “Odd Times” because the yard built her between other jobs when time was available. The timber used was left over from other jobs. 

After the second world war she was used for raking white weed, then laid up for a while before being sold to Dr Gibson. Dr Gibson had a number of planks renewed, the cement ballast chipped out, and a cabin top added which gave her accommodation for 6 people. She was loaned to the Fellowship Afloat Charitable Trustfor 3 years up to 1977, but then returned to being sailed privately. 

New deck beams, mast and boom have been fitted. In 1977 she was sailed to St. Catherine's with the scroll of Tollesbury, to be presented to H.M the Queen. Walter Musset and Sam Gurton, two 84 year olds sailed her with Dr Gibson, both of whom used to sail the Williams and Emily in the past.
boat.short_description: Bee is a Tollesbury Smack, converted to a yacht after WW2
